properties.name: Aryaloka Retreat Centre
properties.description: Posted by Fwbo14 Heartwood Circle, Newmarket, NH 03857-2120, USAAryaloka is a place dedicated to the study and practice of Buddhism. Aryaloka Buddhist Center 14 Heartwood Circle Newmarket, NH 03857-2120 USA (603) 659-5456

properties.name: London FWBO Centre
properties.description: Posted by FwboThe London FWBO Centre - aka the London Buddhist Centre - was a disused fire station in Bethnal Green. It was refurbished and opened as a Buddhist centre in 1978.

properties.name: Nagaloka Buddhist Center (FWBO Portland, Maine)
properties.description: Posted by FwboNagaloka Buddhist Center is located at 51 Ocean Avenue, Portland, Maine 04103. Nagaloka Buddhist Center offers an opportunity for individuals to learn the ancient tradition of Buddhism, and to learn meditation. Nagaloka encourages seekers to come and visit our Center to find out first hand the practice of Buddhism.

properties.name: San Francisco FWBO Center

properties.name: Sudarshanaloka Retreat Centre
properties.description: Posted by FwboSudarshanaloka (meaning "land of beautiful vision") Retreat Centre is situated on New Zealand\'s picturesque Coromandel Peninsula. Situated in the bush-clad Tararu valley near Thames, the 80 hectare property is home to a community of Buddhist practitioners, a seven metre high stupa, numerous retreat cabins for individual retreat and the beginnings of a major retreat centre facility.

properties.name: Sydney FWBO Centre
properties.description: Posted by Fwbo24 Enmore Rd, Newtown, NSW 2042, AustraliaAt the Sydney Buddhist Centre in Newtown we offer instruction and practice in Buddhism and Meditation. We are part of a worldwide movement, the Friends of the Western Buddhist Order (FWBO) which was founded in 1967 by the Venerable Sangharakshita.

properties.description: Posted by FwboThe FWBO/TBMSG recently bought some land just outside of Bodh Gaya to be a base for activities there.

properties.name: TBMSG Sarnath
properties.description: Posted by Fwbo Site of FWBO/TBMSG activities in Sarnath. Location of Dhammaloka International Centre for Buddhist Learning. Just across the road from the Mahabodhi Society Office and the famous Deer Park where the Buddha first taught.
